quest.name: Hard Country
journal: Griseldis is here, but her mind is elsewhere...
objectives: Slay a chapuli for its horn.
Slay a Gyr Abanian hornbill for one of its talons.
Deliver the horn and talon to Griseldis.

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: You'd best keep your distance, if you know what's good for you. Say your piece and move on.

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: Looking for folks down on their luck? Congratulations, you've found one. As you can see, my leg ain't what it used to be. Some days I can hardly walk for the pain.

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: Mornings are the worst, especially after cold nights. Hard labor's right out─too much pain and trouble for others.

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: There's a tea what helps with it, though...I'd need to grind a chapuli horn and a hornbill talon for the blend...

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: Eh? You'll go and get some for me, just like that? You needn't trouble yourself so...

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: ...I've no expectations of aid, mind, but if you happen to pass through the Last Forest and stumble into some chapulis and hornbills...

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: You've been gone a while. What brings you back to Ala Gannha?

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: Oh, I never meant to... I mean, in times like these, you never think people will actually...

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: This country's hard on people, but it's not just that. The imperials, they...they've made it known I'm not to be helped. A dead man's good for one lesson, you know, whereas a live one...

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: You're with the Resistance, right? I suppose there's no reason not to tell you then.

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: My father, gods rest his soul, was deathly sick at the time, and so I'd gone out into the forest, spear in hand, to gather herbs. And then I had the good fortune to run into an imperial patrol.

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: My weapon marked me as a rebel, or so they said. Not that it'd've made a difference if I'd fought back. I knew what the lot of them were about the moment that centurion laid eyes on me...

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: Didn't matter in the end, of course. Some people just like to hurt others. And by the time I limped back to the hut, it was too late for my father.

dialogue.name: GRISELDIS
dialogue.text: Too late for me too, aye, and many others I imagine. Help them too if you like─they'll be grateful and say thank you. But beyond that, I wouldn't hope for much.
